Blog.post: Dragon Boat Festival Saturday I attended the urlLink Dragon Boat Festival at Sloans Lake in Denver. Not far from my home the event is Colorado's premiere showcase of pan-Asian culture, combined with a unique, thrilling athletic competition -- Dragon Boat Racing, an ancient sport that's catching on worldwide. This is one of the boats used in the race. Some children cooling off near the boats. The Dragon! Fixture of the Sloans Lake Neighborhood. A perfect end to a great evening.

Fly Fishing on the Big Thompson Friday I took a day of rest and headed up to Estes Park for some fly fishing. About an hour north of Denver on the outskirts of Rocky Mountain National Park is the Big Thompson River. It was sunny and cool at 7am and there was little to no activity on the surface. In the first hour I landed a Rainbow on a RS2 Nymph. Next came this lovley Lake Trout, I think, on a RS2. After 10am I switched to a Blue Winged Olive dry fly as there was some surface activity. I landed two Browns near the Dam in the next 2 hours. All in all it was a relaxing day. A herd of Elk decided to cross the river several yards in front of me. All protected by this big buck.
Google, the greatest search engine ever engineered, shows us what is was like back in the day. Photo courtesy of urlLink fury.com . urlLink Google Circa 1960 . Please allow 4-6 weeks for results!
Andrew Anderson is now a U.S. Army Captain. For those of you who have not heard Andy Anderson was promoted to the rank of Captain after returning from his tour in Iraq. Congratulations.
Dad to comatose son: I'll buy you a Corvette if you wake up Jason Stackiewicz's $75,000 new car will arrive at his home in September. urlLink Boston Globe

The 4th of July in Colorado Springs. Linda, Shawn and Scot headed down to Colorado Springs to visit Karen Andy, Bree and Katy for the 4th of July. It was good to see them all and relieved to know that Andy is safe and back from Iraq.
Hi-Just signed up. At work in union office. Shannon at home and helping mom with garage sale they made 86.00 yesterday. Sale on today as well but only until noon.

I hiked the Herman Gulch trail on Sunday and did a little Fly Fishing. Herman Gulch is located in the Arapaho and Roosevelt National Forests near Idaho Springs. The trail is 5 miles roundtrip and starts at an elevation of 10,400ft and ends at 12,705ft at Herman Lake. A nice sized pool, formed by a beaver damn was my first query and there were 10-15 small trout feeding on the surface. Here I landed a litte Greenback Cutthroat in a matter of seconds. Several minutes later I landed this tiny Brooke Trout. Small but damn tough when death is on the line. Literaly.
My company, urlLink threefour studios just launched a website for the real estate development firm, Dakota Ridge Development. urlLink Check it out.

If you want to put a picture up on one of your messages - you can upload one onto the internet for free here: urlLink http://www.imageshack.us/ Then you can paste the link onto your message like this : You don't have to sign up or anything! I did it! Then I lost 40 inches on my waistline! See!:::

urlLink Who's taking swear words out of "Murder, She Wrote" books? An unknown culprit in Mormon country has crossed out the nasty words and replaced them with milder words, like "darn," "gosh" or "heck," written in black, purple, green and even pink ink. One library patron says: "It bothers me 'cause I'm trying to read a book. It's distracting." (Deseret News)
Name this blog. What should we call this "web log"? You decide, submissions due immediately! urlLink Email me.
A birthday gift from the Mrs. Craig Sween on Lake Michigan with a fat Chinook Salmon. Mmmmm, Mercury!
He likes mousse. Proclaims this young food experimentor. Silk Tofu + melted chocolate chips + blender + 30 minutes in the fridge = mmmmmmmmm good!
A true Texas Cowboy and American . Not to mention faux President. urlLink Will Ferrel's take on George W. Bush.
